series_name.series_title: International Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques

abstract.par:
This new program celebrates excellence in computer graphics by showcasing images and short animations of extraordinary power and beauty.

The work might be:

• For film: A turnaround of a model or shader

• For film: A final animation, FX, or lighting shot

• For games: a game character or level design

• For games: a killer cinematic

• Or anything in between

The only criterion is mind-blowing excellence. Period.

SIGGRAPH Dailies! is where you can catch up on the state of the art - and craft - of computer graphics.

SIGGRAPH Dailies! is where you will be astounded by sheer excellence in modeling, shading, animation, lighting, effects, and more.

SIGGRAPH Dailies! is where you can participate in the vibrant production culture that surrounds presenting and reviewing work that was completed despite seemingly endless obstacles.

SIGGRAPH Dailies! will be scheduled early on Tuesday and Wednesday. Start your busy SIGGRAPH schedule at Dailies. Grab a cup of coffee, meet your friends, get an agenda, and watch (or present!) the very best of computer graphics in a fun, fast format.

sponsor.sponsor_name: ACM Special Interest Group on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques

abstract.par: How we made an exploding swarm of red plastic monkeys.
Making a hyper real fantasy world for the short film "Nuit Blanche."

article_rec.title: Tangled
article_rec.subtitle: The Pixels Behind the People Behind the Pixels

abstract.par: Two real-time days of rendering are compressed down to a single second by animating the resource usage of the render queue on Tangled.
Digital fx artist Jeremy Hampton explains how the fire-spewing hydra in "Percy Jackson & The Olympians" came to have such dangerous breath.
The first shot of the movie sets up the playtime fantasy of how Andy used to play with his toys.
How we controlled Rapunzel's hair when she fights an intruder in the tower, Flynn, with her hair.

article_rec.title: Loss of Control on Approach Colgan Air, Inc., Operating as Continental Connection Flight 3407 Bombardier DHC-8-400, N200WQ Clarence Center, New York February 12, 2009

abstract.par: Demonstration of how the National Transportation Safety Board uses accident data to create an accident reconstruction animation that is used to explain the circumstances of an accident to the public and entities responsible for implementing transportation safety improvements.
A small shading and lighting project to learn more about RenderMan's depth-of-field and bokeh controls.

article_rec.title: The Tower Waterfall on Disney's Tangled

abstract.par: The creation of the Tangled waterfall, from artist concept to final CG imagery.
he exploding railroad trestle bridge in the opening sequence.
Create a flower growing up through melting snow in two days.

Snow falls in every way imaginable -- and everyone has a slightly different recollection of it. Clearly I needed to do research. After a snowboarding trip I created the snow system for Prep and Landing.

A series of digital concept paintings which explore non-verbal visual narrative construction. My hypothesis is that there are compelling kinds of narrative that can be communicated and understood visually but not communicated or understood verbally.

article_rec.title: Fate of the Apollo 13 crew might have been much different than originally thought

abstract.par: Technically accurate animation of the Apollo 13 mission leads to discovery of an alternative, grave outcome when flight data is re-examined using up-to-date analysis software.

How do we create and render a lush forest and complex characters with fur and hair? How do we gain control of light and shadow shapes in the middle of the forest where trees block out most of the sun and skylight?
How I created a force field effect for Slinky the Dog.

article_rec.title: US Airways Flight 1549 Hudson River crash animation with flight data

abstract.par: US Airways Flight 1549 Hudson River crash simulation using actual flight data provides further insight into the event.

article_rec.title: Prep and Landing
article_rec.subtitle: Area Lights w/ Animated Shadow Blur

abstract.par: Master lighting Timmy's house -- i.e. developing the light setups for the backgrounds, which will be used later on for shot production.
Scrooge blasts into the night sky on the Ghost of Christmas Past's candle snuffer.
Woody and the toys head towards certain death in a junkyard incinerator.
How we set the scene for the "proposal" moment, with one day to go before the screening.

article_rec.title: Satellite collision visualization
article_rec.subtitle: Technically accurate depictions of debris breakup and evolution

abstract.par: This video demonstrates the approach trajectories of the Cosmos 2251 and Iridium 33 satellites prior to impact, as well as a statistical breakup model with an example of propagated debris tracked several days after the event.
The challenge was to create a "cute" character model and rig. The gargoyle made an interesting project since it was both biped and quadruped, and had a flight sequence.
The villain taunts our heroine, Tiana, by materializing 'discouraging' visions in ectoplasmic memory clouds.
The lighting setup for Partly Cloudy. Every kind of character and effect in the film appears in the very first shot -- the last to be completed.

article_rec.title: MADCAT
article_rec.subtitle: Graphical all-on-all conjunction assessment for objects in outer space

abstract.par: Conjunction assessment visualization tool used to determine when objects in space are at risk of colliding with each other.
How a specific shot on Tangled deals with 70 feet of Rapunzel's hair.
This presentation identifies problems and solutions for rendering a Mandelbulb animation.
Animation supervisor Erik Gamache explains why that giant creature doesn't just eat those darn kids.
EFX setups created for a coffee cup and a can of whipped cream.

How a malfunctioning agent brain gave rise to the frenzied rat swarm behavior in Ratatouille. Rats pour through a ceiling, run from a shotgun-wielding granny, and procedurally bounce off furniture without physics simulation.
The main character's fantasy of someday owning a great restaurant in New Orleans takes the form of the art from that time; specifically, the artistic style of the Harlem Renaissance.
Here Scrooge witnesses the effects of the Ghost of Christmas Present aging, until he's merely dust in front of the clock tower.
The elves use a handheld holographic projector to measure the space under the tree for Santa's gift.
Master lighting the first portion of the Epilogue sequence for 'Up' where Carl, Russell and Dug say their farewells to Kevin and her babies.
Trying to find a way to create a watercolor look that would mimic an Art Nouveau print, I stumbled on a process in Photoshop that defines the look of our film "Winnie the Pooh."

article_rec.title: Untitled Lovestory
article_rec.subtitle: the 3D Previs of a feature film

abstract.par: A 2nd time director, a student VFX-Supervisor and a DoP locked themselves into the director's apartment for 3 months and created a 3D previs for the feature film "Untitled Lovestory." They had no clue how to do it, hacked themselves through the jungle of 3D apps and succeeded: 100mins of animated 3D previs.
The shredded trash conveyor belt -- with a challenge from the director on what it should NOT look like.
